meanings.definition: To select or choose carefully by hand.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys handpicking fresh fruits at the market.
meanings.sent2: The farmer is handpicking the ripe tomatoes from the vine.
meanings.sent3: Handpicking the best flowers for the bouquet made her smile.
meanings.sent4: He was handpicking his words cautiously during the interview.
meanings.sent5: The chef was handpicking the herbs with precision for the dish.

meanings.definition: The act of picking or selecting by hand.
meanings.sent1: Handpicking requires patience and attention to detail.
meanings.sent2: The handpicking of apples in the orchard was a labor-intensive task.
meanings.sent3: The handpicking of the winning lottery ticket brought joy to the winner.
meanings.sent4: The handpicking of the best players for the team was crucial for success.
meanings.sent5: The handpicking of books at the library was a relaxing activity for her.
